column4: I typed "sudo rm -rf /". Is there any way to repair the damage? (I stopped it at around /dev)
Load's of settings were lost, but that's about it
what settings were you talking about?
does your other comp run linux?
is there another partition in your current computer?
you could then boot from live cd and mount the disks and copy the files to back up
you should have done sudo rm -rfv / , more fun
there's a youtube video of it
